page.title: 04Landscape
page.content: The area is picturesque and sparsely populated. It lies in the valley of the River Stour between Ashford and Canterbury. The North Downs, lined with belts of trees, rise steeply on either side. The scene is agricultural, fields with arable crops, fruit and livestock. Attractive parkland surrounds Olantigh,a particular feature being the suspension bridge crossing the river to the north of the house. There are many fine views across fields towards the Downs. Crundale is situated in a fold of the Downs and on a summer day when the roses are in bloom seems to be a place apart. Many of the winding lanes are sunken and lined with hedgerows.
